New Records: Luis Arraez is trying to hold off Shohei Ohtani and Marcell Ozuna for the NL batting title.
Yu Darvish tied Hiroki Kuroda for the most pro wins for a Japanese-born pitcher between the United States and Japan with 203 wins.
Key Match Events: The Padres used a four-run first to beat the Diamondbacks 5-3.
The D-backs tried to rally in the ninth but Robert Suarez struck out Ketel Marte and retired Alek Thomas on a groundout to end the game.
The Padres never trailed, jumping to a 4-0 lead in the first inning after Merrill Kelly gave up four hits, one walk and a hit by pitch.
Pre-Game Insights: The Padres will be able to rest their regulars over the next two days, but manager Mike Shildt said getting Luis Arraez to sit might be a tough ask.
Arizona lost the season series to both the Mets and Braves, and the Mets and Braves hold tiebreakers over the Diamondbacks should they finish with the same record.
Post-Match Reflections: Arizona manager Torey Lovullo said, 'We had a lot of fight in us today, but we couldn't close up that early deficit. I think that first inning took a little energy out of us.'

Yu Darvish said through a translator, 'I think I felt a little stiff in the first inning. It was a little longer inning for me, so that maybe helped me loosen up a little. Starting in the second, I felt pretty normal.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Padres secured the No. 4 spot in the National League bracket, meaning they'll host a best-of-three Wild Card Series next week in San Diego.
The D-backs (88-72) sit just behind the Mets (87-71) and Braves (87-71) in a tight race for the final two NL wild cards.
Others: Luis Arraez is one hit shy of 200 for the season.
Manny Machado has a team-leading 105 RBIs this season.
